title: Father arrested for fatal abuse of 2-month-old daughter last year
text:
Police in Osaka have arrested a 24-year-old man on suspicion of fatally abusing his two-month-old daughter at their home last year.

According to police, Hironobu Murata, a company employee, violently shook his eldest daughter Kurumi sometime during the day on Oct 27, 2018, at their home Higashiyodogawa Ward, Sankei Shimbun reported. The infant suffered acute subdural hematoma (bleeding in the brain) and died five days later.

Murata was living with his wife, mother-in-law, and Kurumi. At the time of the incident, Kurumi's mother and grandmother had gone to work, leaving the infant alone with her father. Kurumi’s mother noticed something wrong with her when she returned home from work that night and took her to a hospital the next morning.

After Kurumi’s death on Nov 1, the hospital contacted a child welfare center about a possible case of child abuse. The center contacted police.

Police said Murata, who was arrested on Tuesday, has admitted to shaking his daughter and quoted him as saying, “I got exasperated because she wouldn’t stop crying.”

Police did not say why it has taken one year for them to arrest Murata.
